get.description:
Get Node Metrics

These are in the form of prometheus metrics.

Get Cluster

Get cluster information based on a provided filter.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format requested.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to retrieve delete tasks for.

get.description:
Get Delete Tasks

Returns delete tasks in json format for a given `index_id`.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to retrieve delete tasks for.

post.description:
Create Delete Task

This operation will not be immediately executed, instead it will be added to a queue
and cleaned up in the near future.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to add the delete task to.

200.description: Successfully added a new delete task.

get.description:
Search Index (GET Variant)

Parses the search request from the request query string.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query text. The query language is that of tantivy.

parameters.name: aggs
parameters.description: The aggregation JSON string.

parameters.name: snippet_fields
parameters.description: Fields to extract snippets on.

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: If set, restrict search to documents with a `timestamp >= start_timestamp`.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: If set, restrict search to documents with a `timestamp < end_timestamp``.

parameters.name: max_hits
parameters.description: Maximum number of hits to return (by default 20).

parameters.name: start_offset
parameters.description:
First hit to return. Together with num_hits, this parameter
can be used for pagination.

E.g.
The results with rank [start_offset..start_offset + max_hits) are returned

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format.

parameters.name: sort_by_field
parameters.description: Specifies how documents are sorted.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to search.

post.description:
Search Index (POST Variant)

REST POST search handler.

Parses the search request from the request body.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to search.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query text. The query language is that of tantivy.

parameters.name: snippet_fields
parameters.description: Fields to extract snippet on

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: If set, restricts search to documents with a `timestamp >= start_timestamp`.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: If set, restricts search to documents with a `timestamp < end_timestamp``.

parameters.name: fast_field
parameters.description: The fast field to extract.

parameters.name: output_format
parameters.description: The requested output format.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to search.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to remove.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to create a source for.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to remove the source from.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: The source ID to remove from the index.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to tail.

parameters.name: index_id
parameters.description: The index ID to add docs to.

cluster_id.description: The ID of the cluster that the node is a part of.

end_timestamp.description: If set, restrict search to documents with a `timestamp < end_timestamp``.

query.description: Query text. The query language is that of tantivy.

start_timestamp.description: If set, restrict search to documents with a `timestamp >= start_timestamp`.

DeleteQueryRequest.description:
This struct represents the delete query passed to
the rest API.

end_timestamp.description: If set, restrict delete to documents with a `timestamp < end_timestamp``.

query.description: Query text. The query language is that of tantivy.

start_timestamp.description: If set, restrict delete to documents with a `timestamp >= start_timestamp`.

name.description: Field name in the index schema.

FieldMappingEntryForSerialization.description:
A `FieldMappingEntry` defines how a field is indexed, stored,
and mapped from a JSON document to the related index fields.

Property parameters which defines the way the value must be indexed.

Properties are determined by the specified type, for more information
please see: https://quickwit.io/docs/configuration/index-config#field-types

file_name.description: The file_name is a file name, within an index directory.

Format.description: Output format for the search results.

max_merge_write_throughput.description:
Sets the maximum write IO throughput in bytes/sec for the merge and delete pipelines.
The IO limit is applied both to the downloader and to the merge executor.
On hardware where IO is limited, this parameter can help limiting the impact of
merges/deletes on indexing.

split_num_docs_target.description:
The merge policy aims to eventually produce mature splits that have a larger size but
are within close range of `split_num_docs_target`.

In other words, splits that contain a number of documents greater than or equal to
`split_num_docs_target` are considered mature and never merged.

IndexingStatistics.description: A Struct that holds all statistical data about indexing

num_docs.description: Number of document processed (valid or not)

num_invalid_docs.description: Number of document parse error, or missing timestamps

num_spawn_attempts.description: Number of successive pipeline spawn attempts.

total_bytes_processed.description: Size in byte of document processed

total_size_splits.description: Size in bytes of resulting split

ModeType.description: `Mode` describing how the unmapped field should be handled.

gossip_public_address.description: The SocketAddr other peers should use to communicate.

id.description: The unique identifier of the node in the cluster.

QuickwitJsonOptions.description:
Options associated to a json field.

`QuickwitJsonOptions` is also used to configure
the dynamic mapping.

expand_dots.description: If true, the '.' in json keys will be expanded.

indexed.description: If true, all of the element in the json object will be indexed.

stored.description: If true, the field will be stored in the doc store.

evaluation_schedule.description:
Defines the frequency at which the retention policy is evaluated and applied, expressed in
a human-friendly way (`hourly`, `daily`, ...) or as a cron expression (`0 0 * * * *`,
`0 0 0 * * *`).

period.description:
Duration of time for which the splits should be retained, expressed in a human-friendly way
(`1 hour`, `3 days`, `a week`, ...).

SearchRequestQueryString.description:
This struct represents the QueryString passed to
the rest API.

end_timestamp.description: If set, restrict search to documents with a `timestamp < end_timestamp``.

max_hits.description: Maximum number of hits to return (by default 20).

query.description: Query text. The query language is that of tantivy.

start_offset.description:
First hit to return. Together with num_hits, this parameter
can be used for pagination.

E.g.
The results with rank [start_offset..start_offset + max_hits) are returned

start_timestamp.description: If set, restrict search to documents with a `timestamp >= start_timestamp`.

SearchResponseRest.description:
SearchResponseRest represents the response returned by the REST search API
and is meant to be serialized into JSON.

num_hits.description: Overall number of documents matching the query.

field_name.description: Name of the field to sort by.

num_pipelines.description:
Number of indexing pipelines spawned for the source on each indexer.
Therefore, if there exists `n` indexers in the cluster, there will be `n` * `num_pipelines`
indexing pipelines running for the source.

publish_timestamp.description: Timestamp for tracking when the split was published.

update_timestamp.description: Timestamp for tracking when the split was last updated.

create_timestamp.description: Timestamp for tracking when the split was created.

index_id.description: Id of the index this split belongs to.

num_docs.description: Number of records (or documents) in the split.

split_id.description:
Split ID. Joined with the index URI (<index URI>/<split ID>), this ID
should be enough to uniquely identify a split.
In reality, some information may be implicitly configured
in the storage URI resolver: for instance, the Amazon S3 region.

items.description: A set of tags for categorizing and searching group of splits.

uncompressed_docs_size_in_bytes.description:
Sum of the size (in bytes) of the raw documents in this split.

Note this is not the split file size. It is the size of the original
JSON payloads.
